CLUE: Arab or Muslim at time of the Crusades
FOUND IN: Saracen: A term historically used by Europeans during the Middle Ages to refer broadly to Arabs, Berbers, Persians, and other groups in the Near East who were involved in the Crusades.
Prussia: A significant region with its own state, which had Berlin as one of its capitals before unification.
Prowess: Displaying exceptional skill or ability that sets an individual apart as a master in their respective field.
